intro: Pavetta kenyensis, commonly known as Kenyan pavetta, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and are usually white or pale pink in color.
